descriptions.title: Lhasa Atlas description of "Temple or chapel" building type
descriptions.content:
"Temple or chapel" is used as a particular building type within the Lhasa Atlas by Knud Larsen and Amund Sinding-Larsen. In the "Historical buildings in Lhasa" table at the back of the book (pp. 165-172), buildings of the "Temple or chapel" type are designated with the letter "B" in the building type column. In the THL Place Dictionary, when a building has this feature type and the Lhasa Atlas is given as the source, it means that the building was designated with a "B" in the Lhasa Atlas table.

This building type is described as follows:

"B. Temple or chapel. Example: Lukhang chapel (317).

"Smaller temples are often built in special places for special purposes. A small number of resident caretaker monks or nuns from the overseeing monastery take turns being responsible for the temple's upkeep" (p. 60).

Source:

Larsen, Knud and Amund Sinding-Larsen. The Lhasa Atlas: Traditional Tibetan Architecture and Townscape. London: Serindia Publications, 2001.
